pullRequest.body:
This PR adds multiplicative versions of the existing Prop-valued mixin classes relating vector addition to order.  Also, we rename:

-  `OrderedVAdd` to `IsOrderedVAdd`
-  `CancelVAdd` to `IsCancelVAdd`
-  `OrderedCancelVAdd` to `IsOrderedCancelVAdd`

---


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsCancelSMul`
`+ IsCancelVAdd`
`+ IsOrderedCancelSMul`
`+ IsOrderedCancelVAdd`
`+ IsOrderedSMul`
`+ IsOrderedVAdd`
`+ instance (priority := 200) [LE G] [LE P] [SMul G P] [IsOrderedCancelSMul G P] :`
`+ instance [LE G] [LE P] [SMul G P] [IsOrderedSMul G P] : CovariantClass G P (· • ·) (· ≤ ·)`
`+ instance [OrderedCancelCommMonoid G] : IsOrderedCancelSMul G G`
`+ instance [OrderedCommMonoid G] : IsOrderedSMul G G`
`+ instance [PartialOrder G] [PartialOrder P] [SMul G P] [IsOrderedCancelSMul G P] :`
`+ smul_lt_smul_of_le_of_lt`
`+ smul_lt_smul_of_lt_of_le`
`- OrderedAddCommMonoid.toOrderedVAdd`
`- OrderedCancelAddCommMonoid.toOrderedCancelVAdd`
`- OrderedCancelVAdd.toCancelVAdd`
`- OrderedVAdd.toCovariantClassLeft`
`- instance (priority := 200) OrderedCancelVAdd.toContravariantClassLeLeft [LE G]`
`- vadd_lt_vadd_of_le_of_lt`
`- vadd_lt_vadd_of_lt_of_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
bors merge

bors r-

I don't think we should merge this without the docstrings for `OrderedSMul` and `IsOrderedSMul` disambiguating themselves against the other spelling
Canceled.
Sorry, I had not picked up the suggestion underlying your initial comment.

bors d+

No worries, the suggestion was mainly "let's get more input from Yael to decide what to do next"

:v: ScottCarnahan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981594196/job/27585552991)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981594196/job/27585553827)
How does this differ from the existing [`OrderedSMul`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Module/OrderedSMul.html#OrderedSMul)?

They seem to be almost completely different:

- `OrderedSMul` is about strict inequality, while `IsOrderedSMul` is about `LE`
- `OrderedSMul` requires `G` to be an ordered semiring and `P` to have `OrderedAddCommMonoid` structure.  However, the algebraic structures do not appear in the defining `Prop`s.
- `OrderedSMul` conditions only trigger for strictly positive elements of `G`, while `IsOrderedSMul` more or less requires `G` to be made of non-negative elements.  I'm really only interested in the additive version, where this condition is meaningless.

I am a little concerned about the near collision in names, but the `OrderedSMul` module docstring suggests that it may be deprecated at some point in the future.
Maybe @YaelDillies has thoughts

To explain, this is the same distinction as between `OrderedCommMonoid` and `OrderedCommMonoidWithZero`.

I indeed hope `OrderedSMul` will go away soon, but it's a bit more complicated than I had originally hoped

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor (Algebra/Order/AddTorsor) : Add multiplicative versions of everything, use to_additive
